repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Anton Seidl was a noted Wagnerian conductor and chorus master. He was born in Pest, Hungary, was a member of Wagner's household from 1872 to 1878, during which time he served as Wagner's musical secretary and later as conductor of the Richard Wagner Theater in Beyreuth. He was a close friend of Wagner's and had much to do with the spread of his music and influence through Europe and America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, letters, memoranda, memorabilia, and manuscript music scores assembled by and related to the life and musical activities of Anton Seidl. The collection includes many letters from Cosima Wagner and her children addressed to Anton Seidl and Mrs. Seidl. There are also letters from Lilli Lehman, Edvard Grieg, Antonin Dvorak, Bronislaw Hubermann, Carl Goldmark, Maud Powell, Marianne Brandt, Felix Weingartner, Lyman Abbott, and many others. The letters are chiefly concerned with musical performances, composition, and related affairs. There are journals, diaries, and memoranda in Seidl's hand, as well as photographs and clippings relating to his conducting career. Also, twenty-seven manuscript scores of Seidl's orchestrations of various works.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into 5 series:

list.item: Series II: Cataloged Documents and Manuscripts

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The following boxes are located off-site: 7-48. You will need to request this material from the Rare Book and Manuscript Library at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance to use the collection in the Rare Book and Manuscript Library reading room.

prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Anton Seidl Papers; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library..
